item.title: How I made: Stylized Heightmaps pt. 1
item.description: What are heightmaps? A heightmap is a raster image or more generally a grid that contains elevation data. Each value in the grid stores the height of the particular location. It’s usually visualized as a grayscale image, with black being the minimum height, and white the maximum. We’re not, however, going to be generating a grayscale image, but rather render a stylized version of that heightmap. Something that looks like this:
